হীরেন্দ্র কুমার গরাই
You can call me Hiren
Hirendra Kumar Garai
hirendra.garai@ntu.edu.sg
Konnichiwa!
info Japanese — Good afternoon

I am a cryptography researcher working on the analysis and security of symmetric-key primitives. My work involves using automated tools like SAT solvers, MILP, and SMT solvers to find vulnerabilities in ciphers, alongside exploring quantum computing applications in cryptanalysis.

Work

Current and previous positions

Research Fellow
School of Physical and Mathematical Sciences, NTU Singapore
Jan' 2025 - Present

Working with Prof. Thomas Peyrin on symmetric-key cryptanalysis and automated cryptanalysis tools.

Post-doctoral Researcher
IIT Madras
Oct' 2024 - Dec' 2024

Post-doctoral researcher under Prof. Santanu Sarkar focusing on differential-linear cryptanalysis of stream ciphers.

Research

Topics and publications

My research focuses on the security analysis of symmetric-key cryptographic primitives, particularly stream ciphers and block ciphers. I develop and apply automated techniques to discover vulnerabilities and improve cryptanalytic methods.

Research Topics

Differential-Linear Cryptanalysis Stream Ciphers (ChaCha, GRAIN) SAT/MILP/SMT Solvers Quantum Cryptanalysis Automated Tools

Selected Publications

  • Grover on Chosen IV Related Key Attack Against GRAIN-128a
    with A. Maitra, A. Samanta, S. Kar, M. Mandal, S. Dey — INDOCRYPT 2023
  • Cryptanalysis of Reduced Round ChaCha — New Attack and Deeper Analysis
    with S. Dey, S. Maitra — FSE 2023
  • Enhanced Differential-Linear Attacks on Reduced Round ChaCha
    with S. Dey, N. K. Sharma, S. Sarkar — IEEE TIT 2023
  • Revamped Differential-Linear Cryptanalysis on Reduced Round ChaCha
    with S. Dey, N. K. Sharma, S. Sarkar — EUROCRYPT 2022
